briefTitle: A Research Study in Chinese Children With a Low Level of Hormone to Grow. Treatment is Somapacitan Once a Week Compared to Norditropin® Once a Day.
officialTitle: A Trial Comparing the Efficacy and Safety of Once Weekly Dosing of Somapacitan With Daily Norditropin® in Chinese Children With Growth Hormone Deficiency
summary: The study compares two medicines for children with a low level of hormone to grow: somapacitan (a new medicine) given once a week and Norditropin® (a medicine doctors can already prescribe) given once a day. Researchers will test somapacitan to see how well it works, compared to the standard treatment with Norditropin®. The participants will either get Norditropin® once every day or somapacitan once every week - which treatment the participant gets is decided by chance. The participant and the study doctor will know which treatment the participant gets. The study includes a 52 week treatment period and a minimum of 30 days follow up period.
